page.title: 07DUFTON WOOD FARM 1 _STOCK
page.content: We milk 25 cows & rear all the calves from them,heifer calves for herd replacement & bull calves sold to beef feeders.Cows are sold as new-calved 2nd calvers.The milk is picked up daily by a bulk tanker & taken to Appleby Dairy to make cheese. Of our flock of Swaledale sheep,225 are run with the Swale rams,& spend summer on the open fell & most of the winter in the enclosed allotment,apart from bad storms.Then we have to bring them down to lower ground at home.The rest of the Swales are crossed,150 with a Teeswater for Masham lambs,& 35 with a Suffolk ram.These are summered in the allotment & then gimmer lambs are sold in the autumn to go further down country.Our Swaledale gimmer lambs are kept & the wether lambs fed fat on turnips which we grow.
